subtitle.Text: Karla: So these are all the VHS tapes, or most of them, in the house and these, in the TV room are from - they only belong to dad and Sam, because mom has some VHS tapes but they’re up in the bedroom.
And you can tell dad’s because he writes in a big, heavy, all-caps style handwriting, and Sam does not. So, contrary to popular opinion, the X-Files tapes are not dad’s, they’re in fact Sam’s.
Steve: But stuff like JFK has an obvious dad interest and some of the other stuff that we put in there was very much like, what is a dad movie? When we were growing up, for instance,
like, what is a movie that our dad or a neighbor’s dad would have, so stuff like the Andromeda Strain or Moonraker it’s just sort of like, yeah, dads -
Steve: Dads that were born in the ‘50s were super into that kind of stuff. And then some of it was stuff that we liked or remembered from when we were growing up like ahh…
You will know that Karla was involved in making this game because Beetlejuice and RoboCop are on a VHS tape. That’s most of what you need to know about Karla, right there.
